definition: guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt

sentences.english: To his family, their guilt, to work, but no regrets.
sentences.chinese: 对家人，她们心存内疚，对工作，却无怨无悔。

sentences.english: His guilty conscience forced him to make a clean breast of everything.
sentences.chinese: 他的内疚使得他把一切尽兴宣露。

sentences.english: If you feel guilty about doing this, don’t be.
sentences.chinese: 如果你觉得这么做你会有内疚感，那就大可不必。

sentences.english: She looked up guiltily as I came in.
sentences.chinese: 我进来时，她内疚地抬起了头。

sentences.english: I took one guiltily, lit it and smoked with satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 我内疚地接过一枝点上，心称心足地抽起来。

sentences.english: This lack of flexi-working creates pressure and guilt.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏弹性的工作造成了压力和内疚。

sentences.english: Spin guilt into a positive action.
sentences.chinese: 把内疚感化为积极行动。

sentences.english: Does anyone else get the guilts when it comes to spending money?
sentences.chinese: 还有任何其他人在花钱的时候感到内疚吗？

sentences.english: She acted out the role of a wronged lover to make him feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她装出一副受委屈的情人的样子，以让他感到内疚。

sentences.english: He glanced guiltily over his shoulder.
If I tell a lie to somebody, I will face her guiltily .
sentences.chinese: 如果我向某人说谎了，我再面对她时会内疚。

sentences.english: I felt a twinge of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 我感到一阵痛彻心扉的内疚。

sentences.english: I am sorry to say your answer is not very satisfactory.
sentences.chinese: 很内疚，的回答不太令满意。

sentences.english: A big obstacle in this battle against disengagement is guilt.
sentences.chinese: 在对抗脱离的这场战斗中，一个大的障碍就是内疚。

sentences.english: What celebrity could you cheat on your spouse with guilt free?
sentences.chinese: 什么样的名人可以使你在欺骗配偶之后，不会内疚呢？

sentences.english: I felt really sorry for the girl and became even guiltier for drinking my champagne.
sentences.chinese: 我的视线转移到了香槟，感到一丝内疚和责任。

definition: to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
